meanings.sent1: The teacher marshalled the students into a straight line for the fire drill.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers marshalled themselves into a perfect formation before the parade.
meanings.sent3: The ducks were marshalled in a line behind the mother duck, ready to waddle to the pond.
meanings.sent4: The books on the shelf were marshalled neatly, standing at attention like little soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The colorful toy blocks were marshalled into a rainbow pattern, creating a beautiful display.

meanings.definition: Lead or direct in an organized way.
meanings.sent1: The coach marshalled the players onto the field for the championship game.
meanings.sent2: The general marshalled his troops with precision before the battle.
meanings.sent3: The traffic officer marshalled the cars through the intersection with dance-like moves.
meanings.sent4: The conductor marshalled the orchestra with graceful gestures, guiding them through the symphony.
meanings.sent5: The teacher marshalled the students through the museum, pointing out interesting exhibits along the way.
